channel.title: Wat
channel.description:
[u][b]Were these items in the 377 era?[/b][/u] 3rd Age Ava's Accumulator Skillcapes Dark bow Rune c'bow
[u][b]Other[/b][/u] Also, I made a 3D Array for theiving objects, and I am getting an Out of Bounds error whenever I try to steal from the stall.
Array:
[code=java] public int[][] theftStalls = { {4706, 4708, -1, -1}, // Veg Stall [0] {2561, -1, -1, -1}, // Baker's Stall [1] {4874, -1, -1, -1}, // Crafting Stall [2] {4876, -1, -1, -1}, // General Stall [3] {2560, 629, -1, -1}, // Silk Stall [4] {7053, -1, -1, -1}, // Seed Stall [5] {4877, -1, -1, -1}, // Magic Stall [6] {631, 2562, 6162, 6570} // Gem Stall [7] };[/code]
I'm not going to post all of the code for how I use it, but this is an example:
The loop:
[code=java] for(int stall = 0; stall < theftStalls.length; stall++) {[/code]
Then I would do:
[code=java] case 4706: // Veg Stall case 4708: thiefStall(theftStalls[0][stall], randomVegStall(), "Vegeteble"); theftDelay = System.currentTimeMillis(); break; case 2561: // Baker's Stall thiefStall(theftStalls[1][stall], randomBakerStall(), "Baker's"); theftDelay = System.currentTimeMillis(); break;[/code]
Does anyone know what is causing it?
Also, last question: Would just importing all the NIO Classes give NIO Networking? And what are the benefits of using NIO Networking?

item.title: Wat
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:15, topic:386036”][quote author=Clawz fury link=topic=481787.msg3529340#msg3529340 date=1300047061]

Array index out of bounds 4, looks like you are starting at index 1 instead of index 0.

And that means…???
[/quote]thiefStall(theftStalls[1][stall], randomBakerStall(), “Baker’s”);

First off, what is [stall]? And what is randomBakerStall() (the code)[/quote]
The loop for stall is shown.

[stall]: {2561, -1, -1, -1},

Code: public static int randomBakerStall() { return bakerStall[(int)(Math.random()*bakerStall.length)]; }

Read full topic

item.title: Wat
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“relmitos, post:6, topic:386036”]The main advantage of NIO over basic IO is that nio has non-blocking sockets. And it consumes less cpu since it doesnt require a single thread for each socket.
There are alot more advantages, but in short NIO > IO.[/quote]
Thanks, that really helped.

[quote=“Impious Lols, post:7, topic:386036”]Can you think of a more creative title than “wat”? I mean seriously. People don’t know if you have an item related question or command or anything. We can’t even tell what base you’re using.

Suggestion Example: “[Delta]377 Item Help[Delta]”

-Troll ;D[/quote]
Does it really matter what base I am using? Also, I can make the title whatever I want.

To conclude my statement; wat

Read full topic

item.title: Wat
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

The main advantage of NIO over basic IO is that nio has non-blocking sockets. And it consumes less cpu since it doesnt require a single thread for each socket.
There are alot more advantages, but in short NIO > IO.

Read full topic

item.title: Wat
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

Were these items in the 377 era?
3rd Age
Ava’s Accumulator
Skillcapes
Dark bow
Rune c’bow

Other
Also, I made a 3D Array for theiving objects, and I am getting an Out of Bounds error whenever I try to steal from the stall.

Array:

public int[][] theftStalls = { {4706, 4708, -1, -1}, // Veg Stall [0] {2561, -1, -1, -1}, // Baker's Stall [1] {4874, -1, -1, -1}, // Crafting Stall [2] {4876, -1, -1, -1}, // General Stall [3] {2560, 629, -1, -1}, // Silk Stall [4] {7053, -1, -1, -1}, // Seed Stall [5] {4877, -1, -1, -1}, // Magic Stall [6] {631, 2562, 6162, 6570} // Gem Stall [7] };

I’m not going to post all of the code for how I use it, but this is an example:

The loop:

for(int stall = 0; stall < theftStalls.length; stall++) {

Then I would do:

case 4706: // Veg Stall case 4708: thiefStall(theftStalls[0][stall], randomVegStall(), "Vegeteble"); theftDelay = System.currentTimeMillis(); break; case 2561: // Baker's Stall thiefStall(theftStalls[1][stall], randomBakerStall(), "Baker's"); theftDelay = System.currentTimeMillis(); break;

Does anyone know what is causing it?

Also, last question: Would just importing all the NIO Classes give NIO Networking? And what are the benefits of using NIO Networking?
